fields.description: We should upgrade the version of docutils we're using (0.7), some newer directives (like code-block) are missing at the moment.
fields.summary: Upgrade Docutils version (BB-7182)

fields.description:
Issue sorting is currently not stable.

Example:

* If I sort my issues according to milestone first, I get version 1.0 issues first, then 2.0 issues.
* If I then sort according to priority, all of the 'critical' issues will be on top, but the critical 1.0 issues will be interspersed with the 2.0 issues.
fields.summary: Multi-column issue sorting (BB-8056)

fields.description:
I love what you guys have done with the approval mechanism. I think this is much better than the way that Github works because it lets you say that you approved the pull request but still leave it open for other  teammates to look at.

Here's how we've been using this: If David submits a pull request and I'm the first person to approve it, I do NOT merge it. I leave it open for others to look at. We don't have a strict policy on who reviews the pull requests and when. Sometimes, a day will go by and no one else will review the pull request and we deem it okay for the owner of the PR to go ahead and do the merge. (All of our users have read/write to the repos).

It would be cool if you could enforce that it had to be reviewed before it could be pulled in by the owner.
fields.summary: Prevent owner of Pull Request from merging without (n) number of approvals (BB-7214)

fields.description: Invite says "Invitiation sent to", it should read "Invitation sent to".
fields.summary: Typo on invitation (BB-7183)

fields.description: It seems that every string in the form of :\d+ is able to link only to a commit on Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Custom Link (Repositiory link) Rew Regexp set to content todo:(\d+) never gets matched / linked

fields.description:
This might be useful in debugging the problem:\\
754eeb8a38304385b4907830846db3f8$6ab196f35c270f4f1ad1f64369a19bdf
fields.summary: Custom Link (Repositiory link) Rew Regexp set to content similar to (\w*?) produces a 500 error on the commits list

fields.description: I've noticed that the bitbucket.org/explore/ page is empty and has been for some time. Is that intentional?
fields.summary: Explore page empty?

fields.description:
I'm sure this is well documented already, but everyone on the repo receives emails for every sigle issue created regardless of assignee, which is extremely annoying and spammy.

it'd be great if this could be fixed at some point :)
fields.summary: Email notifications on issue tracker

fields.description:
I have a small project with two developers.  I'm the owner of the project.  I added an issue and assigned it to my partner.  I got an email notification that a new issue was created and assigned to my partner (which is appropriate, as I'm the project owner).  My partner, however, was never notified.  I can find no configuration setting in the project or our accounts that discusses issue assignee notifications.

Assignees should obviously be notified when they have new issues to work on.

(For what it's worth, I am able to send my partner messages through BitBucket by visiting his profile, so I know his account's email address is configured properly.)
fields.summary: send email notification to assignee on issue assignment

fields.description:
When submodules are displayed in a repository, the link to the root of the submodule repository works, but the specific revision goes to an incorrect url. It appears to be missing the project name. For example a subrepos to https://github.com/ShareKit/ShareKit, the link in brackets next to it goes to https://github.com/ShareKit/commit/43f8432ed7fda4f988be5d90d9c832880884ac13 rather than the correct https://github.com/ShareKit/ShareKit/commit/43f8432ed7fda4f988be5d90d9c832880884ac13.

This also applies to BitBucket links as well as GitHub ones, but I am not sure of the correct url for changesets in order to give a good example. It appears to be missing the repository name as well.
fields.summary: Submodule revision links are broken in source browser (BB-7244)
Adding an apostrophe in front of an issue reference for an issue with a local_id of 3 will result in the apostrophe being escaped and also rendered as an issue link (BB-7174)

fields.description:
I have a similar problem to:\\
https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/3033/pushing-to-bitbucket-authorization-failed

I am setting up a new machine, cloning went fine, I've copied old ssh keys, but when doing hg push I get:

{code}
#!sh
hg push
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket/rkj/dotfiles
...
http authorization required
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP
user: rkj
password: 
abort: authorization failed
{code}

I have no idea why it tries http instead of ssh for one, I've tried with https too:

{code}
#!sh

$ hg push
pushing to https://rkj@bitbucket.org/rkj/dotfiles
...
http authorization required
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP
user: rkj
password: 
abort: authorization failed
{code}

I am pretty sure I am entering the right password (I've tried copy pasting the same thing to web UI...).\\
It could be that it's trying to push to some other repository, as I have couple of them in .hgsub, but there's no indication which one it would be. I did diff with -S and there are not changes in any subrepos. On my other machine where I have https clone the user is auto filled, here it's not...

I did the test from troubleshooting, and it seems ok:

{code}
#!sh

$ ssh -T hg@bitbucket.org
conq: logged in as rkj.

You can use git or hg to connect to Bitbucket. Shell access is disabled.

{code}

My hg version is 2.2.2
fields.summary: Cannot push to repository rkj/dotfiles

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to change the repository source for Pull Requests.

I had a case where I was not able to change the repository source after pushing the branch from my fork to the main repository so that others could more easily collaborate on a long Pull Request.

Workaround is to create a new pull request, but that does not copy across comments from the original.
fields.summary: Change repository source for Pull Requests

fields.description:
See http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/. In that reference, creator talk about HTML tags support. bq. Markdown can be configured to produce HTML-style tags; e.g.:\\ {{
}} Why BitBucket Wikis hasn't that? I want to add {code}
123
456
{code} Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Md in Wiki hasn't HTML tags support

fields.description:
Hello

https://bitbucket.org/quadms/tryitout/commits/114829ffc25df12f352a8076d306c694

the user who has committed this, is not granted permission into this private repository. But is able to commit.
fields.summary: Non Members are able to commit into the repository

fields.description:
I've added some people to private repositories. The job was done and now I want to remove them. I deleted the repositories. Now I'm on *Plans and billing* trying to remove the people that doesn't work with me anymore.

I remove then successfully, but when I reload the page, they come back on the list.
fields.summary: Users from Plans and billing

fields.description: error
fields.summary: error

fields.description:
In teams viewing the master branch as the "main" development path, it would be nice to be able to mark issues as "resolved" only when their associated commit is effectively merged in the master branch. (or is effectively in its history)\\
Currently, issues are marked resolved when the associated commit is pushed to any branch. As we frequently push to feature branches during development, it's quite difficult to keep track of the effectively resolved issues.
fields.summary: Resolve issue only when associated commit is merged with specified branch (BB-7163)

fields.description: The "system busy" indicator is spinning and nothing happens
fields.summary: "update pull-request" doesn't work

fields.description:
As in title, with a git repository, after publishing an empty new branch—I used the github client—in the "Recent Activity" section I get the first commits instead of the last ones.

After pushing some other commits I get the new ones just pushed and right after the first ones.

The commit history in the "Commits" panel is fine and the history seems right.
fields.summary: [git] After publishing a new (empty) branch the "Recent Activity" section shows only the first commits (BB-7168)

fields.description: When using a # in a image file name it cause the image to not be found in the description section of an issue(404's) when uploaded.
fields.summary: # used in image attachments cause link error. (BB-7164)

fields.description:
When replying to an issue via email, from the address "michael@smart-africa.com", the following text is displayed in the issue tracker for my comment:

(Reply via mich...Gábor Békefi-africa.com):

This indicates that the @smart portion of my email address has been expanded to a Twitter username, which is incorrect.
fields.summary: user@domain-name incorrectly expands to a twitter user (BB-7073)

fields.description: Hello, the HipChat hook is working fine, but we miss a very simple option that we loved on GitHub: the room notification option. With it turned on, room members would receive a notification once a commit is pushed to a repo. Right now they have to remember to check the room every once in a while, which isn't optimal in certain circumstances.
fields.summary: Add room notification option to HipChat Service Hook (BB-7167)

fields.description:
I have a small group of people working on multiple projects and classes.  We basically have a repo for each of our major classes that relate to our projects.  I'm sure that's nothing special.

But even in our small instance it would be super helpful if there was an issues page where I can see all the currently active issues, which repo they're in, what the status currently is,  and who is responsible for them.  I lose track of which projects have issues and which don't.  At this point we have about 15 repos making it time consuming to go through them.  I can only image what it'd be like for a larger group with an exponential amount more projects than I do.

Thanks\\
GW
fields.summary: Issue tracking feature request

fields.description: It would be possible for you to arrange things so bitbucket pages serve ".webapp" files with the Content type: application/x-web-app-manifest+json?
fields.summary: Add Content-Type: application/x-web-app-manifest+json in pages

fields.description: Fonts a rendered in a strange way (see screenshot) when browsing source through Opera (v12.12). Everything is OK when browsing with FireFox or IE.
fields.summary: Opera - Incorrect fonts when browsing source

fields.description:
I like that you can see the history of wikis as commits.

However, it might be useful (and consistent with the 'normal' commits) to be able to add comments to a commit, and so discuss about the changes

Thanks\\
Bogdan
fields.summary: add comment to line - in wikis

fields.description:
it would be nice to get the added Symlinks removed.\\
But only the busyboxes not the Toolbox links.

Thanks a Lot, great Job till now
fields.summary: no Symlinks were removed on delete/deinstall the Busybox

fields.description:
I recently started working on the PEP 432 implementation as a branch in my cpython_sandbox repo (https://bitbucket.org/ncoghlan/cpython_sandbox/commits/featurebranches)

After asking for help with patches to keep the Windows builds working, Richard Oudkerk discovered that it isn't possible for him to send a pull request from his existing clone of the CPython mirror to my sandbox, which is also a clone of the CPython mirror.

This seems like an unnecessary restriction, since I was still able to do the merge manually by pulling the change from Richard's clone and merging it into mine.
fields.summary: Allow creation of pull requests between sibling repos (forks of same parent) (BB-7166)

fields.description:
Embed button of the public repository.\\
when paste a source code,I protrude aside.\\
add element.style "overflow: auto;"

Sorry, I can speak English only a little.
fields.summary: overflow of the source code (BB-7162)

fields.description:
Today I just get a simple checkout and I lose the history

Getting the whole history imported would be really appealing and would help the transition to bitbucket .

Note that the same would apply for hg
fields.summary: When I import a SVN repository in git, the whole history should be fetched using git svn (BB-7165)

fields.description:
It would be great if we could get an email notification whenever a commit has been made, much like how it is for the wiki and issue system. It would also be good to see who has puled or cloned the repository.

Thanks
fields.summary: Commit Notifications

fields.description:
Who is Charles Guse?  This person should NOT have access to my Repo.

I unassigned an issue and instead of the Assignee being -- it is some random BitBucket user.  This is not good.  See screenshot.

There is no Charles Guse on my team.
fields.summary: Unassigning issue sets it to Charles Guse (BB-7159)

fields.description: For some teams, the pull request workflow isn't appropriate. There should be a way to disable pull requests against a repo.
fields.summary: Add ability to disable pull requests (BB-7143)

fields.description: Always leads to page 1 (commits 1-30)
fields.summary: Can't page through commits (BB-7141)

fields.description: When an issue is created in Bitbucket there should be an option to also create the same issue under a linked project in JIRA.
fields.summary: Create a JIRA issue from Bitbucket (BB-7142)

fields.description: Given the gloriousness of the other bucket icons, it'd be great if Objective-C had it's own unique icon.
fields.summary: ObjectiveC Bucket icon missing

fields.description:
The automatically generated zip,gz, and bz2 files of branches is really handy, but it would be great if the Last-Modified timestamp in the header was set to the timestamp of the last push (the last time the branch was modified).

The current timestamp of the Last-Modified header is the time the request for the archive was made.

We want to use the header to check if we need to download a new version.  We use this to automatically update an apps content while in development.
fields.summary: Set the Last-Modified header of the Download branches files to that of the last push (BB-7137)

fields.description:
I realized some [time ago|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/119381/which-if-any-markup-is-accepted-in-commit-messages] that commit's comments can only contain links to issues and similars but nothing like bold/italics/bullet lists\inline code.

I think it could be useful to (optionally?)allow (some)Markdown on them. For example a commit message like:

{code}
#!plaintext


Improved class ``SomeClass`` and fixed issue BCLOUD-53:

  -  The ``this_method`` method now <something>
  -  The class provides a new invariant ...
  -  Refactored ``big_method``s code into two submethods ``submethod_a``, ``submethod_b``. 
{code}

Would be rendered:

Improved class {{SomeClass}} and fixed issue BCLOUD-53:

* The {{this_method}} method now <something>
* The class provides a new invariant ...
* Refactored {{big_method}}s code into two submethods {{submethod_a}}, {{submethod_b}}.

Is there a reason for not providing this feature?

Obviously I'm not saying to add markup to be rendered everywhere(e.g. in bitbucket's home where you see only the summaries of the commits), but in the deatiled view I think it would be simply fine to have.
fields.summary: Allow to have some markup to commit's comments (BB-7136)

fields.description: ... Either by treating as markdown, html or similar or keeping the text formatting and not mungling the text as a one big blob string rendered poorly in html
fields.summary: When I add a repository description, I want my text formatting to be respected (BB-7161)

fields.description:
nathan@nathancahill.com is on my team, but if i set my email in get as nathan's (eg git config --global user.email "nathan@nathancahill.com") and commit bitbucket accepts this fine (even though i am logging in via my account) and then when the commit happens it looks as though nathan made the commit on the commit history, not myself.

Granted this is with git - so you may not be able to do anything about it, but it leads to some odd behavior if i have a global email address in git as "x@gmail.com" and commits with my "x@easypost.co" account show up as commits from "x@gmail.com"
fields.summary: commit tags dont validate ownership of email address

fields.description:
inside a repo > Administration > Username aliases

Initially, 'User' input has focus, but if it looses it (you click outside of it), you can not focus  it again by clicking (you can only select it by pressing Tab)
fields.summary: can't click input - Username aliases (BB-7135)

fields.description:
This issue...\\
https://bitbucket.org/sgbarlow/buildit/issue/7/documents-can-have-comments

Has been assigned to Charles guse. I've never heard of him and he is not in my project. Does this mean he can see my private repo?
fields.summary: one of my issues has become assigned to someone i dont know

fields.description:
When removing the assignee, I get a message on the issue "assigned issue to Charles Guse". Example: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/issue/1072/search-result-was-not-shown-when-i-search#comment-2813660

This is apparently because Charles has picked the username "none".
fields.summary: Unassign issue: change message in issue shows up as "assigned issue to Charles Guse" (BB-7159)

fields.description: Error returned by Amazon ECS {code} #!XML This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below. AccessDenied Invalid according to Policy: Policy Condition failed: ["eq", "$success_action_redirect", "http://code.progmaatic.com/progmaatic/travel-postcards/downloads/add"] 316E5E27F919B65F 2EnTZhSDSfDwWzPGdhlfTaS1Cr52BLxHS9x7JsAVuSAFp4vRGvnajGBd641JrKR1 {code}
fields.summary: Error when upload finished in the download section of a repository under custom domain

fields.description:
I deleted: swiftblue/Wiffleman

When I click on the repo in the activity it says deleted, but I can not create a new repo of the same name, nor can I transfer ownership of a repo to this account if it has the same name.
fields.summary: Deleted Repo Issue

fields.description:
Whenever I or team members try to clone the repository, we get a "early EOF Remote end hung up unexpectedly index-pack failed"  error sometime during the middle of the cloning process.

We use Smartgit for our git client since my team members are non-technical users.

This is preventing everyone on the team from cloning the repository at the moment :-/
fields.summary: Cannot Clone Repository (Remote end hung up unexpectedly)

fields.description:
I get a http 500 error when trying to view a specific source file, repeatedly.

The url is :\\
https://bitbucket.org/ansell/sesame/src/321c2d4d2fa0f67105636ad9de5894f6a7a9207d/core/queryresultio/api/src/main/java/org/openrdf/query/resultio/TupleQueryResultWriter.java?at=SES-1669

It seems to be specific to that file, I can open other java files in the same repository/branch without problems.

the error page gave this code as "useful for debugging": 9680c7a17ab24203abbd6e7bd6479f92$722ed0255fee5b450fd4152fd4a48935
fields.summary: 500 error when trying to view java source file (BB-7139)

fields.description:
Hello!

Love bitbucket, it's awesome.

However, we've got loads of repositories and it would be useful to be able to see all the pull requests by Team, or even by user within that team on repositories within that team (if that makes sense). We'd find it super useful to be able to see at a glance what projects have pull requests open at any given time.

Cheers,

Mark
fields.summary: Viewing all pull requests within a team

fields.description: In the past I have accidentally created a repository and then deleted it right away, but neither of those events can be removed the newsfeed. Would it be possible to have a delete button added next to events so we can clean up the newsfeed?
fields.summary: Allow deleting items from the newsfeed
Push failing with "Remote rejected - failed to lock"

fields.description:
What would be super awesome is to have deploy keys that we can set under the team's settings that then apply to all repos under the team.

A use case is that we have an internal server that runs or hubot. This server does our deploying for us and needs read only (deploy key) access to every repo that we use. It's a bit of leg work to have to add the deploy key to every repo as we add new ones.

I was thinking of using the API to do it, but would really like it if it could be a global option for the team.
fields.summary: Team deploy keys (BB-7170)

fields.description:
Today, only pull requests from my repo to the upstream repo are possible.\\
Github supports that alright and this is quite convenient to keep a repo fresh quickly online.\\
Furthermore, the current behavior is misleading: when I "Swap source and destination" then "Create Pull Request" the pull request created will not match the source and dest I see, but always from my repo to upstream
fields.summary: When I compare a project that I forked, I want to create a pull request from the cloned fork to my clone (BB-6653)

fields.description: Hi, can you please make the list of tags accessible when not in the overview page? Thanks.
fields.summary: List of tags when not in overview (BB-7169)

fields.description:
I'm trying to give a dev team outside my organisation read access to a few repos. As I'm not a member of their team, I can't give them Group access, but the "User" picker allows me to type in a Team name even though it doesn't appear in the dropdown.

Of course, adding a Team doesn't given the team members access to anything.

We should fix two things:

# Make it clear in the User picker that adding a Team won't work (or make it work)
# When we decide that we won't make it work, add a method to get permission from a Team to give one of its Groups permission. In my case I don't even need permission to browse the external Team's Groups - I just need the ability to add the group to my repo.
fields.summary: Giving a Team access to a repo does... nothing useful (BB-7113)

fields.description:
The checkbox on the messages (inbox and sent) should have 2 states, select current page and select all.

Useful for marking as read and deleting.
fields.summary: Messages select all (BB-5806)

fields.description:
I have just discovered that the icon for projects with LaTeX as language doesn't have a proper default logo [1] and projects with TeX as language have LaTeX as default logo [2].

Could you please fix both?

It would be really great, if you also added ConTeXt as a language and a proper logo.

Many thanks for your help,

Pablo

[1] !https://dwz7u9t8u8usb.cloudfront.net/m/1994bc81118f/img/language-avatars/default_128.png!

[2] !https://dwz7u9t8u8usb.cloudfront.net/m/1994bc81118f/img/language-avatars/latex_128.png!
fields.summary: TeX and LaTeX language avatars are wrong (BB-7140)

fields.description: Currently, only the first/last commit will include information about the branch/tag it was on. This was by design originally, but should be changed for service brokers like the email service and others.
fields.summary: Include branch and tag information for every commit in a push payload to service brokers /  hooks (BB-7110)

fields.description: If a user has made a comment on a changeset on a pull request or directly on a line comment, a strip operation may fail. In this case, support can help strip the changeset, but the user will no longer have any access to the comments or pull requests that the changeset was present on.
fields.summary: Repository strip operations may fail if the changsets being removed have comments from a Pull Request or a line-comment (BB-6715)

fields.description:
Oftentimes, I find myself talking about particular issues or commits to several teammates at a time. It would be nice if the messaging system would allow us to link issues, commits, and usernames just like what we are able to do when posting comments. This would help us improve our productivity since we don't have to copy-paste issue and commit references between email and bitbucket anymore.

This issue is related to BCLOUD-3687, where I originally posted a comment because I want the multiple recipients feature.
fields.summary: Allow linking issue numbers and commit hashes to messages (BB-7105)

fields.description: Every branch pushed with a commit that auto resolve an issue repeats the same changes to an issue
fields.summary: Duplicate messages when automatically resolving on pushes (BB-7112)

fields.description:
Hi!

Google has a "disable social features of my account" feature to

* remove Google+ account and all related data
* remove user's +1s for Google search results

I would like to request similar feature for Bitbucket so that I

* allow no followers
* can't follow others
* have no "recent activity" feed on my profile page

...\\
This might be an issue of simply having the option to customise my own profile page layout.

Thanks.
fields.summary: add an option to disable social features (BB-7104)

fields.description:
I am trying to set up an issue tracker for one of my repositories... The documentation found  here (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Enabling+an+Issue+Tracker) indicates that i should go to the left hand side of the repository settings.

Try as i can i cannot see such an option for my repository.

I have no left hand list of items as shown in this document

the attached image shows what i see from whithin bitracker.
fields.summary: I am probably blind.

fields.description: I deleted the account assigned to two email addresses. After this action, I can not use these addresses for a new account. *xxxxxxx@gmail.com is already in use by another user.* User has been removed, but the two addresses are blocked.
fields.summary: I can not use an email address on the account is deleted

fields.description:
I have this project: https://bitbucket.org/jwdevel/pjam

When I go to the wiki for the project, I get a 404 page.

The same problem applies to two of my other projects: pjam-base, test.

I believe I created this project before bitbucket had wikis standard for all projects. Perhaps it is in a broken state on the server side?

From the current documentation, it seems like I shouldn't have to do anything special to get a wiki for a project. Yet it remains broken ):

Notably, one of my projects, pjam-dev, does have a wiki. I had explicitly created one for it back in the days when that was necessary.
fields.summary: my project has no wiki

fields.description: when i clone a repo with capital letters like FollowWallWithPololuDualMotorDriver on a mac with Source Tree it creates the directory with *all lower case*s.  the lack of proper naming causes my editor to have issues (this is a simple arduino application).
fields.summary: clone with Capital Letters

fields.description: We're paying for Bitbucket OnDemand, so why is this limit in place for us? Giving team members access to our repositories is an essential functional requirement in our day-to-day software development practice. Having this limit in place is a constant drag on our ability to develop software efficiently.
fields.summary: When I give more than 4 members of my team write access to my repositories, the system degrades all their permissions to read-only.
Allow users to delete git branches through the UI (BB-3336)

fields.description:
I tried to create a C# repo and it just hung up doing so, now everytime I tri to access to it I see the screen in the attached picture.

Help please D:

Edit: Now I have 3 repos hung (if you have to delete them, only delete the ones with the name Crow on it please)
fields.summary: Creating repository hung up

fields.description: Search commits its not working. When i do a search he show the number of commits but not the commits itself.
fields.summary: Search commit not working

fields.description: Very usefull feature. You can see proposal very clearly on image added to this issue.
fields.summary: Show latest commit message and date for directories when browsing source (BB-7096)

fields.description: When I try to see a big commit I received an error 500
fields.summary: 500 error when viewing big commit (BB-7172)

fields.description:
Dear all,

There seems to be a problem with the look of the login window in the Epiphany browser. Please look at the screenshot. The edit boxes don't fit into the white login panel.

Regards\\
jcache_dev
fields.summary: Epiphany browser login window look

fields.description:
I have been trying to search the commits tab of my project and i get no results (or right results).\\
I have searched by the commit string and by the commit hash and no luck.

I think it has worked previously but not very well though.
fields.summary: search in commits tab not working

fields.description: I use bitbucket both at work and at home on the same machine. I've setup a SSH identity for my work bitbucket account, my at home account allows access to two people (no one from my work account, including me). When I pulled my git repo from my home account, I was prompted to enter credentials via https (using Git Extensions). However, when I did a commit/push it didn't ask for my credentials and used my ssh identity from my work account committing to my personal git repo using my work account. I double checked the permissions after committing and it shouldn't have access to do this.
fields.summary: Able to commit to a private repository I don't have access to

fields.description: On PRs, I'm clicking merge then getting a dialog saying "unable to merge"... but i fyou then refresh the page it's merged.
fields.summary: spurious "unable to merge" error dialog (BB-7095)

fields.description:
How to reproduce:

# Go to an existing issue
# Write a long-winded, detailed and useful comment
# Press ESC
# Cry your eyes out as the comment instantly disappears before your eyes

Expected:

# Never to lose my data
# Failing that: Never to lose my data from a single keystroke
fields.summary: Pressing ESC in a bug-comment-editor widget destroys the content in it (BB-7086)

fields.description: When I post a reply on an existing issue, I also want to watch that issue most of the time. But I always forget to watch the issue, so I miss out on important information. I think this problem could be solved by adding a "Watch this issue" checkbox underneath the reply form, preferably checked by default. That way I won't forget to watch issues I'm replying to.
fields.summary: "Watch issue" checkbox under reply form (BB-7087)

fields.description:
I just tried to strip the changeset 9470ff75558da6469a844b708f1339d565f5149c from my repository https://bitbucket.org/rbdl/rbdl. At bitbucket.org also claims that it worked, yet gives the message "Bundle file not created".

However when revisiting the repository the strip has not been done.

Is there anything I can do?
fields.summary: Strip fails (Message: Bundle file not created.)

fields.description: Trying to send a repository invite to m@certabr.com (not a user AFAIK), but it says the e-mail is not valid.
fields.summary: Can't send invitation if email user has just one char

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I am testing the functionality of your services.\\
I was very pleased when testing it under Firefox and Chrome.\\
I tried it with IE 8 and the website (https://bitgucket.org) is completely messed up (see attached screenshots).\\
For my needs the website has to work correctly under IE 8 and I cannot upgrade it.

Could you let me know solution to this problem?

Thank you in advance,\\
Krzysztof
fields.summary: Problems with displaying content in IE 8

A language avatar for Haskell projects would be nice.

when I search for a commit, it says it has found something (as in attachment) but it does not list anything.

Marco

fields.description:
It will be good if I can look into other projects which are most watched, updated, downloaded etc for a language or as a whole.

Currently once logged in we are not seeing an explore link . Its not a bug, but a feature I would like to have.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Explore

fields.summary: Branches not deleting

fields.description:
attempted to import a repo from github and it appears to have failed.  repo is just now unavailable and i am not able to retry the import or delete to the repo.  at this point i would just like to remove it, but not sure how to.

thanks,
fields.summary: repository is unavailable

fields.description: It would be useful to have [Julia|http://julialang.org] syntax highlighting and the ability to select the Julia language for a project.
fields.summary: Support for Julia language syntax highlighting (BB-7089)

fields.description:
After committing a file to the repository and clicking on the link. i.e. cfa5088 - Change-Id: I3251f3bb06f741d40476ad68dfafc769726fdb9f

I get the error "Oops, you've found a dead link"

I have tried committing the same file a number of times from Zend studio. each time the submission works fine with no errors, But when looking on bitbucket the file does not seem to have been committed even though in overview the file is acknowledged.
fields.summary: Oops, you've found a dead link

fields.description:
I'm a heavy user of the Dashboard RSS feed to follow and manage projects. However, many of the items are useless as they don't provide actual information, or links to the related objects, nor related comments.

These items include wiki edits and wiki page creation, approval of commits (only says things like "larsivi cset_like amber"), commenting on commits at the very least.

To make things worse, it seems to be impossible to "see more" on the Dashboard or Project overview pages in case there is so much activity that what I've not really read about in the RSS is no longer in view on the webpage.
fields.summary: Useless descriptions in RSS (BB-7091)

fields.description:
Please confirm GIT work correct in bitbucket. Recent, we lost some file while we not commit to delete that files. Please review https://bitbucket.org/vietnametravel/vietnametravel in last good commit 6405c4a and next commit not change file apps/travel_utils/data_utils.py but it changed.

Please advice me do not trouble with this bug again
fields.summary: Auto delete and change files while my team not commit

fields.description: Required clone tab for Issues also
fields.summary: Clone Issue feature

fields.description:
I created the bitbucket user 'jas' a while back and have been using your service for quite some time.  I've most recently been pushing to jas/drawterm-cocoa but then noticed that a new user 'jasp' managed to create quite a few repositories that for a brief period of time had my user, 'jas', as the admin/owner.  I received emails about the repository creation and changes.

This is most likely a bug that should be addressed before more users are granted short term admin rights to repositories they haven't created.
fields.summary: repo creation notices

fields.description:
When I fork one of my private repositories (to the same team account), the issue tracker of the fork becomes public (although the source was private).

- Felix
fields.summary: fork of private repository makes issues public (BB-7092)

fields.description:
Someone following me can see those messages, even though the repositories are private and he has no access to them.

- Felix
fields.summary: newsfeed contains "... granted ... access ..." from private repositories (BB-7102)
Git commit search doesn't return results (BB-7085)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
I create a group for my organization and invited 4 people. Since then, a number of other people in my org have been invited (not be me or anyone I invited) and I'd like to know what is happening. Just today, members of the org received invitation emails...which I did not initiate.

I invited the first 4 users listed in the screenshot. Don't know how the other two got invited.

Thanks,\\
Eric
fields.summary: You've been invited to collaborate on code emails

fields.description: The HipChat broker current truncates commit messages that are longer than 80 characters. This should perhaps not be the case.
fields.summary: Enable showing more than 80 characters in the HipChat broker (BB-7084)

fields.description:
Print Icon only works on print report page  On the search and create page no print function or on the results page or the show page.

Open for suggestions if it (print Icon)  could  work on all those pages if not then on results page and show page

Also, the print appears to be Landscape not portrait can we make that either or ??

System check card

If the check card fails on 1st attempt , can we have the verbage read

System Check Card failed refer to User Manual for additional instructions. In red as well to match our other warnings

Thanks  Oscar
fields.summary: Print Icon
